Description: Rim sherd of East Greek Wild Goat Style pottery dinos; white slip; interior: reserved with black band at rim; on top of flat rim, double guilloche pattern between bands; exterior: top of wall glazed, above dot and billet band; below, tongue pattern; painted decoration consisting of lion (part of forehead and mane remaining), to left; swastika and pendant triangle as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Lemos places this sherd in the Würzburg Chalice Group; however, according to Williams it is not Chian, even if the clay is typically Chian. The sherd belongs the same vessel as British Museum 1924,1201.939.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 71, p. 245, no. 281, pl. 35)
Price 1924 / Pottery of Naukratis (p. 216, pl. 10, no. 3)
Walter-Karydi 1973 / Samische Gefässe des 6. Jahrhunderts vor Christi: Landschaftsstile ostgriechischer Gefässe (p. 138, no. 695, pl. 98)
Williams 2006a / The Chian Pottery from Naukratis (p. 132 not 10)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.248)
